traits\\trait_id.json.title: Globally Unique ID trait
traits\\trait_id.json.description: A globally unique identifier of the content in the ANS repository.

traits\\trait_version.json.title: Describes the ANS version of this object
traits\\trait_version.json.description: The version of ANS that this object was serialized as, in major.minor.patch format.  For top-level content objects, this is a required trait.

traits\\trait_owner.json.title: Owner information
traits\\trait_owner.json.description: Trait that applies information about the owner (typically a news organization) to a document.

owner.description: Information about the owner of this content.

id.description: The unique identifier for this owner. In the Arc ecosystem, this is often used to store the organization id.

sponsored.description: Necessary for including/excluding advertorial and native content in search results, story card features.

traits\\trait_revision.json.title: Revision
traits\\trait_revision.json.description: Trait that applies revision information to a document. In the Arc ecosystem, many of these fields are populated in stories by the Story API.

revision_id.description: The unique id of this revision.

parent_id.description: The unique id of the revision that this revisions was branched from, or preceded it on the current branch.

branch.description: The name of the branch this revision was created on.

editions.description: A list of identifiers of editions that point to this revision.

user_id.description: The unique user id of the person who created this revision.

published.description: Whether or not this revision's parent story is published, in any form or place

traits\\trait_additional_properties.json.title: Has additional properties
traits\\trait_additional_properties.json.description: A grab-bag object for non-validatable data.

traits\\trait_canonical_url.json.title: Canonical URL
traits\\trait_canonical_url.json.description: The fully qualified URL to the story. In the Arc ecosystem, this will be populated by the content api from the arc-canonical-url service if present.
